ows:ServiceIdentification.ows:Title: GeoServer Web Map Tile Service
ows:ServiceIdentification.ows:Abstract: A compliant implementation of WMTS service.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic coastline low res (line)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Prepared Cooper A.P.R BAS 2011 from various sources. This data has been generalised from the antarctic-coastline-line-high dataset. Used ArcMap generalisation tool with maximum offset of 1km.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic vegetation units
Layer.ows:Abstract:
Credit: Alaska Geobotany Center home page (http://www.geobotany.uaf.edu/) Mapped polygons at 1:7.5 million scale contain many vegetation types. The map often portrays the dominant zonal vegetation within each mapped polygon. Zonal sites are areas where the vegetation develops under the prevailing climate, uninfluenced by extremes of soil moisture, snow, soil chemistry, or disturbance, and are generally flat or gently sloping, moderately drained sites, with fine-grained soils. Large areas of azonal vegetation that are dependent on specific soil or hydrological conditions, such as mountain ranges and large wetlands, were also mapped.

The legend contains 15 vegetation mapping units, which are named according to dominant plant functional types except in the mountains where complexes of vegetation are named according to the dominant bedrock (carbonate and noncarbonate mountain complexes). The coloring scheme of the map is suggestive of the physiognomy of the vegetation. The plant functional types are based on a variety of criteria including growth form (e.g., graminoids, shrubs), size (e.g., dwarf and low shrubs), and taxonomical status (e.g., sedges, rushes, grasses). The legend takes into special consideration the stature of woody shrubs, which is a major diagnostic feature of zonal vegetation in the Arctic.

Very steep bioclimate gradients occur in mountains, so these areas are mapped as complexes of elevation belts. Mountainous areas of the map are shown with hachures; the background color indicates the nature of the bedrock, and the color of the hachures indicate the bioclimate subzone at the base of the mountains.

Layer.ows:Title: South Georgia glacier change
Layer.ows:Abstract: Compendium of glacier front change and glacier point location datasets.

Layer.ows:Title: SG snow petrel breeding locations
Layer.ows:Abstract: Trathan P et al, BAS 1996.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic place-name labelling
Layer.ows:Abstract: Compendium of all place-name labelling datasets.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic circle
Layer.ows:Abstract: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arctic_Circle. Created in PostGIS, BAS 2012.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic rock outcrop (all resolutions)
Layer.ows:Abstract:
Seamless dataset for Antarctic rock outcrop, applicable to all zoom levels. A compendium of polygon data which shold display well at all zoom levels.
High resolution data from ADD version 5 with minor consistency updates. Due to be replaced in 2015 with data deduced from high resolution remotesensing imagery.
Medium and low resolution data have generalisations of 100m and 1km respectively applied using ArcGIS.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic seamask medium res shapefile
Layer.ows:Abstract: Created as an emergency measure (2017-06-02) when a new version of medium res seamask was created and found to not render substantial parts of the data via Geoserver when ingested into PostGIS

Layer.ows:Title: LIMA RGB lossless mosaic
Layer.ows:Abstract: Landsat Image Mosaic of Antarctica, served as ECW coverage. See http://lima.usgs.gov for more details.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops BAS Twin Otter Aircraft runways
Layer.ows:Abstract: Point locations of runways suitable for the BAS Twin Otter Aircraft, bases with associated ice landing strips.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic bathymetry
Layer.ows:Abstract: IOC, IHO and BODC. 2003. The Centenary edition of the GEBCO digital atlas, published on behalf of the Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission and the International Hydrographic Organization as part of the General Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans (GEBCO); British Oceanographic Data Centre, Liverpool. General Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans (GEBCO)

Layer.ows:Title: South Georgia current routes (points and tracks)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Compendium of waypoint and track data for currently used tourist routes on South Georgia.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic rock outcrop med res
Layer.ows:Abstract: ADD5 version with minor updates for consistency.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Rothera drumline
Layer.ows:Abstract: Drumline on Adelaide Island separating local travel area and technical travel area.

Layer.ows:Title: Sub-Antarctic coastline (med res)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Medium detail data for Sub-Antarctic islands and S American coast. Provided as part of the ADD visualisation, but data not part of the ADD proper. South Georgia data taken from South Georgia GIS (http://www.sggis.gov.gs), Heard and Macquarie Islands data formerly in ADD version 5. Coastline polygons for : South America (south of -50), Falkland Islands/Malvinas, Bouvet Island (NO), Campbell Island (NZ), Auckland Island (NZ) taken from 1:10000000 datasets available on Natural Earth (http://www.naturalearthdata.com) version 3.0.0. Generalisation tolerance of 100m applied in ArcMap 10.0.

Layer.ows:Title: SG Terrestrial Specially Protected Areas (SPAs)
Layer.ows:Abstract: GSGSSI data, amended by Poncet S, BAS 2007. Reworked to 200m contour in Fanning Ridge area Herbert D, BAS 2008.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Rothera runway crossing
Layer.ows:Abstract: Crossing over Rothera runway - take care.

Layer.ows:Title: SG surface types
Layer.ows:Abstract: Location of rock outcrop, ice, lakes and glacial moraines. Source : Poncet S, updated and combined datasets for 2004 BAS 1:200000 scale map Misc 12A, adding moraines.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Ryder Bay submerged rocks
Layer.ows:Abstract: Areas of submerged rock - to be aware of when travelling in the waters around Ryder Bay.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Rothera Field Ops Manager points 2014-15
Layer.ows:Abstract: Field site points for BAS field operations manager for 2014/2015 Antarctic season. Points are grouped by coloured dot with sledge callsign letter to enable easy identification of a field project field sites.

Layer.ows:Title: SG whaling station plans
Layer.ows:Abstract: Original plans drawn by Basberg B, 1993. Georeferenced and digitised using Quickbird and other remote sensing imagery Herbert D, BAS 2009.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Ryder Bay offshore rocks
Layer.ows:Abstract: Locations of offshore rocks in the waters around Ryder Bay. Includes average height above/below water surface (avg_z).

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic rock outcrop low res
Layer.ows:Abstract: ADD5 version with minor updates for consistency.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Rothera drumline waypoints
Layer.ows:Abstract: Point locations of drums along Adelaide Island drumline separating local travel area and technical travel area.

Layer.ows:Abstract: ETOPO DEM, clipped to the interactive map extent, taken from Alison Cook's 2010 SPRI Arctic map.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic lakes high res
Layer.ows:Abstract: From ADD5 1998-2011. Very incomplete, and includes only surface lake features (not sub-glacial lakes).

Layer.ows:Title: SG rivers and streams
Layer.ows:Abstract: Source : datasets for 2004 BAS 1:200000 scale map Misc 12A. Updated for Thatcher Peninsula by Cook A, BAS 2009.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Ryder Bay authorised boat access
Layer.ows:Abstract: Authorized access only boating areas in Ryder Bay - boatman only zones!

Layer.ows:Title: Ops airunit waypoints 2013-2014 season
Layer.ows:Abstract: Airunit waypoints for season 2013-2014 - editable layer for updating coordinates and other information. notes field free to add any additional information that may be useful.

Layer.ows:Title: SG vegetation distribution
Layer.ows:Abstract: Source : Fretwell P, Poncet S, BAS 2007 NDVI interpretation of Landsat images, with corrections based on personal knowledge. Divided into full, sparse and fellfield areas. See habitat mapping.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Ryder Bay twin-engine boating limit
Layer.ows:Abstract: Outer twin engine boating limit of Ryder Bay.

Layer.ows:Title: SG restricted impact areas (MPAs)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Source GSGSSI 2009.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic lakes med res
Layer.ows:Abstract: Generalise dataset from the antarctic_lakes_high data. Very incomplete.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops DASH point of no return (PNR)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Polygons showing the point of no return for the BAS DASH-7 Aircraft, from DASH-suitable groomed ice runways. The point on a flight at which the DASH has just enough fuel, plus any mandatory reserve, to return to the airfield from which it departed.

Layer.ows:Title: SG pipit nesting areas
Layer.ows:Abstract: Herbert D, BAS 2008 from guidelines by Poncet S, BAS 2007. Pipits are widespread and may be found in all rat-free areas and offshore islands.

Layer.ows:Title: SG bathymetric contours
Layer.ows:Abstract: Contour line data created from the SGBD (2008) and GEBCO bathymetry.

Layer.ows:Title: SG coastline plus South Sandwich Islands and South Orkney Islands
Layer.ows:Abstract: SG mainland : Poncet S, October 2007, interpretation of Landsat images together with personal knowledge. Updated Herbert D, BAS 2008 to include Clerke/Shag Rocks. Further update Herbert D, BAS 2009 to include coastline for Bird Island from aerial photography (Fox A, 1999). South Sandwich Islands revised from 1956 naval map (systematic shift and exaggerated size of Montague Island due to a typographical error), updated 2012 from VHR imagery. South Orkney Islands from Antarctic Digital Database (ADD - http://www.add.scar.org).

Layer.ows:Title: SG penguin colonies
Layer.ows:Abstract:
(Macaroni) Poncet S, BAS 2007 from census data 1985/6-2003/4.
(Gentoo) Trathan P, 1999 from original paper-based South Georgia GIS. Processing Herbert D, BAS 2007.
(King) Poncet S, BAS 2007, from census data 1984-2002.
(Chinstrap) Colony locations Poncet S, BAS 2007 from census data 1971/2-2006/7.

Layer.ows:Title: SG fur seal population density 1991
Layer.ows:Abstract: Source : Poncet S, BAS South Georgia Land & Visitor Management Report to GSGSSI 2003, interpreted by Cooper P, Herbert D, BAS 2007.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic coastline med res (polygon)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Prepared Cooper A.P.R BAS 2011 from various sources. Generalised from the antarctic_coastline_polygon_high most detailed dataset for use at 1:1000000 scale. Used ArcMap generalisation tool with a maximum offset of 100m. All features with an area < 10000 square metres were subsequently removed.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic Facilities from COMNAP

Layer.ows:Title: SG coastal landing restriction
Layer.ows:Abstract: 0.25 nautical mile buffer around the entire mainland SG coast, designating an exclusion zone within which no helicopter landing is permitted.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic moraines high res
Layer.ows:Abstract: A minor update of the version in ADD5. Very incomplete, and may be a candidate for removal altogether.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic coastline high res (polygon)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Prepared Cooper A.P.R BAS 2011 from various sources (metadata on each bounding line segment is contained in the antarctic_coastline_line_high dataset). This is the most detailed polygon data for land south of -60. Updated January 2013, Fretwell P, BAS, from remote sensing imagery dating from 2011. Main areas of update : Antarctic Peninsula and South Orkney Islands. Last update 4 Feb 2016. Major updates to ice coast from Polar View Sentinel-1 imagery December 2015. Minor updates around major ASPAs Feb 2016.

Layer.ows:Title: SG glacier change locations
Layer.ows:Abstract: Simple WMS labelling layer for the glacier change dataset.

Layer.ows:Title: SG Maritime Zone 200nm boundary
Layer.ows:Abstract: 200 nautical mile zone defined using the South Georgia baseline and a buffer of 200nm from the South Sandwich Islands. Note that this does not include similar buffers from Clerke and Shag/Black Rocks as previously.

Lehner, B. and P. Döll (2004): Development and validation of a global database of lakes, reservoirs and wetlands. Journal of Hydrology 296/1-4: 1-22.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic gazetteer
Layer.ows:Abstract: Full GeoNames dataset for places north of 60N.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic contours (all resolutions)
Layer.ows:Abstract:
Seamless Antarctic contour dataset, applicable to all resolutions. A compendium of three line datasets which should display well at all resolutions.
High resolution version prepared Cooper A.P.R, BAS 2011. Updates around Pine Island Glacier/Burke Island by Fretwell P, BAS 04/05/2012. Further updates around the Antarctic Peninsula and South Orkney Islands January 2013, Fretwell P, BAS. Sources of individual line segments are contained in the data attributes. Last update 14/01/2015.
Medium and low resolution datasets have generalisations of 100m and 1km applied using ArcGIS.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic coastline high res (line)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Prepared Cooper A.P.R BAS 2011 from various sources. Each line segment is attributed with metadata concerning its source, updater and update time. This is the most accurate data for land south of -60. Updated January 2013, Fretwell P, BAS from remote sensing imagery dating from 2011. Main areas of update : Antarctic Peninsula and South Orkney Islands. Further updates to ice coast December 2015 from Polar View Sentinel-1 SAR imagery. Minor updates to areas around major ASPAs February 2016.

Layer.ows:Title: South Georgia Habitat Maps
Layer.ows:Abstract: Compendium of habitat mapped areas and boundaries.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic top-level extended place-names
Layer.ows:Abstract: Large scale feature place-name dataset. Used BAS Misc15 map (2010) as source and guide for digitising name annotations. Done in ArcMap 10 by Bazeley, K BAS 2012.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic extent of Boreal forest

Layer.ows:Title: SG habitat map boundaries

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic islands
Layer.ows:Abstract: Dataset from GeoNames January 2012, filtered by importance according to BAS Misc15 map.

Layer.ows:Title: Rock outcrop derived from Landsat 8

This work is distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License.

Carse journey 1955, second (southern) journey 1956 - Poncet S, pers comm with Alec Trendall Aug-Oct 2007, interpreted Herbert D, BAS 2007 using Carse The Survey of South Georgia 1951-7, reprinted in The Geographical Journal, Vol CXXV Part 1, March 1959.

Shackleton route 1916 - Poncet S, pers comm with Alec Trendall Aug-Oct 2007, interpreted Herbert D, BAS 2007.

Layer.ows:Title: Sub-Antarctic coastline (all resolutions)
Layer.ows:Abstract:
Seamless dataset for Sub-Antarctic region (50-60S). A compendium of three line datasets which should display well at all resolutions.
Most detailed data for Sub-Antarctic islands and S American coast. Provided as part of the ADD visualisation, but data not part of the ADD proper. South Georgia data taken from South Georgia GIS (http://www.sggis.gov.gs), Heard and Macquarie Islands data formerly in ADD version 5. Coastline polygons for : South America (south of -50), Falkland Islands/Malvinas, Bouvet Island (NO), Campbell Island (NZ), Auckland Island (NZ) taken from 1:10000000 datasets available on Natural Earth (http://www.naturalearthdata.com) version 3.0.0.
Medium and low resolution datasets have had generalisations of 100m and 1km applied in ArcGIS.

Layer.ows:Title: ADD data limit (60S)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Version 6.0.0 27/04/2012. Line of latitude -60S denoting the limit of scope of the ADD datasets. Some coastline polygon data may be offered north of this limit, but is provided purely for context and does not form part of the ADD itself. Such data will generally be of less accuracy and is less well attributed.

Layer.ows:Abstract: Polygons showing the point of no return for the BAS Twin Otter Aircraft, from bases with associated ice landing strips. The point on a flight at which the Twin Otter has just enough fuel, plus any mandatory reserve, to return to the airfield from which it departed.

Layer.ows:Abstract: All resolution polygon data for Antarctica from ADD, styled for the CCAMLR GIS.

Layer.ows:Abstract: From the Rothera area map 2016, BAS MAGIC.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic rock outcrop high res
Layer.ows:Abstract: ADD5 version with minor updates for consistency. Will be replaced 2015 with dataset automatically derived from remotesensing imagery.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic ice feature catchment areas
Layer.ows:Abstract:
GLACIAL CATCHMENTS: METADATA

Three databases have been merged to give this file:

  1. an amended Randolph Glacier Inventory file (Bliss), which covers most of the islands around Antarctica.
  2. a detailed analysis of Northern Peninsula (Graham Land) glacier catchments (Cook)
  3. a new analysis of the catchments of the main Antarctic Ice Sheets and Palmer Land (Fretwell).

Glacier types are included in the Bliss data, but as these are rather arbitrary for many areas of Antarctic they have now, as yet, been included in the other datasets. Details of this first dataset is covered in the original publication:

Bliss, A., R. Hock and J. G. Cogley, 2013. A new inventory of mountain glaciers and ice caps for the Antarctic periphery. Ann. Glaciol., 54(63), 191-199, doi:10.3189/2013AoG63A377

METHOD

The second and third datasets use the same methodology to compute catchments but have different granularity. Each is based upon ARCGIS hydrological analysis.

Catchments are constructed by dividing the outflow (in this case the grounding line) into discrete parts and using a flow-direction grid to calculate which parts of the ice-sheet flow to each outflow. The flow-direction is in turn calculated from a detailed surface elevation grid. In the case of the Cook dataset this surface grid is a specific 100m detailed DEM based on ASTER data, ref:

Cook, A. J., Murray, T., Luckman, A., Vaughan, D. G., and Barrand, N. E.: A new 100-m Digital Elevation Model of the Antarctic Peninsula derived from ASTER Global DEM: methods and accuracy assessment, Earth Syst. Sci. Data, 4, 129–142, doi:10.5194/essd-4-129-2012

The Fretwell analysis uses the new 1km Bedmap2 surface elevation dataset, ref:

Fretwell and Pritchard et al. Bedmap2: improved ice bed, surface and thickness datasets for Antarctica. The Cryosphere, 7, 375-393, 2013

As the two datasets were constructed from different resolution data and were made for slightly different end products the detail of the datasets is slightly different; the Cook data divides the grounding line into many more catchments, this is possible as the area of interest of this data is the Northern Antarctic Peninsula (63 to 70 degrees south) where most ice is in the form of marine terminating valley glaciers.

The Fretwell dataset tends to have less discrete outlets. This is due to the terrain over the majority of the Antarctic where the coastline is mainly in the form of calving ice-cliffs that are not constrained by topography. Here discrete ice-streams have been identified using velocity data (Rignot, E., J. Mouginot, and B. Scheuchl (2011), Ice Flow of the Antarctic Ice Sheet, Science, doi 10.1126/science.1208336.) and the RAMP dataset (Jezek, K., and RAMP Product Team. 2002. RAMP AMM-1 SAR Image Mosaic of Antarctica. Version 2. Fairbanks, AK: Alaska Satellite Facility, in association with the National Snow and Ice Data Center, Boulder, CO. Digital media).

The nature of the Fretwell data, especially around headlands and ice piedmonts, breaks the catchments into fewer discrete parcels.

One point that should be noted of the methodology: It works from information at the grounding line. This results in some well known ice-streams being merged together, especially if they form a single ice-stream at the grounding line. Examples of this are the Mercer and Whillans Ice streams (formally Ice Stream A and Ice Stream B) that converge landwards of the grounding line and are a single entity at the point where they flow into the Ross Ice Shelf; for our dataset this is considered one catchment.

NAMING

Naming of glacier has been added in conjunction with the SCAR composite gazetteer; the largest glacier or feature has usually been used. In many areas especially those around the coast or around small headlands or drainage basins this field has been left blank.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Rothera buildings 2016
Layer.ows:Abstract: Polygon shapefile of Rothera building site map. Created from BAS building services CAD drawing 2014, revised Gerrish L, BAS Feb 2016 correcting systematic shifts w.r.t remotesensing imagery.

Layer.ows:Title: SG Southern Giant Petrel population by area
Layer.ows:Abstract: Source : Poncet S, BAS 2008 (unpublished data).

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic elevation data (Peninsula only)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Locations of what are recognised as either 'Mountain', 'Peak', Massif', 'Nunatak' or 'Ridge' in the CGA gazetteer. Elevation is given in meters and calculated from various sources, for example Palmer Land ASTER GDEM. Elevations should be considered estimates and may contain errors.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Rothera hazard zones
Layer.ows:Abstract: 'Exclusion zones' (keep out for your own safety) and 'caution zones' (take care not to touch masts or cables) on Rothera Point.

Layer.ows:Title: SG distribution of invasive species
Layer.ows:Abstract: Distribution of rats, mice and reindeer on SG mainland. Source : Poncet S, BAS 2007.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic moraines med res
Layer.ows:Abstract: Antarctic moraine dataset, created by generalisation from the high resolution data. Suitable for use in 1:1000000 mapping.

Layer.ows:Title: SG Northern Giant Petrel population by area
Layer.ows:Abstract: Indication of percentage of the NGP population by area. Source Poncet S, 2008 unpublished data.

Layer.ows:Title: SG no catch zones
Layer.ows:Abstract: The current (2011) state of play for no catch areas. SG/Clerke/Shag Rocks have 12nm exclusion zones in which no fishing is permitted. SSI currently have 3nm zones around them, which may (2011) be increased to 6nm.

Layer.ows:Title: Radarsat 2 RAMP mosaic HV ECW
Layer.ows:Abstract: Radarsat 2 RAMP mosaic HV polarization

Layer.ows:Title: Sub-Antarctic coastline high resolution to 30S
Layer.ows:Abstract: Sub-Antarctic coastline, extended by including data from naturalearthdata.com version 3.0.0 (downloaded 04/03/2016) to 30S.

Layer.ows:Title: SG polar fronts
Layer.ows:Abstract: Antarctic Polar Fronts dataset, in South Georgia Lambert projection.

Layer.ows:Title: SG topographic contours
Layer.ows:Abstract: Thatcher Peninsula : Cook A, BAS 2009 from aerial photography DEM, 25m precision. Rest of SG mainland : Fretwell P, BAS 2007 from datasets for 2004 BAS 1:200000 scale map Misc 12A, 100m precision.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic seamask low res
Layer.ows:Abstract: Seamask created by subtracting coastline polygon data (Antarctic and Sub-Antarctic) from a 50S polygon.

Layer.ows:Title: SG low flying avoidance areas
Layer.ows:Abstract: Avoidance data and text supplied by S. Poncet. Map design and compilation by the Mapping and Geographic Information Centre, British Antarctic Survey, 2004.

Layer.ows:Title: SG current route tracks
Layer.ows:Abstract: Whittamore L, BAS 2007 GPS data St Andrew's Bay->Sorling, Maiviken Hike, Grytviken->Mt Hodges), GSGSSI data 2009 (KEP->cemetery, KEP->Hope Point, Grytviken station->church, Grytviken station routes), Poncet S, South Georgia Environmental Baseline Survey 1999-2002, map 14 (Fortuna Bay Shackleton hike).

Layer.ows:Title: NASA Blue Marble image acquired April
Historic journeys on South Georgia
Layer.ows:Abstract: Compendium of waypoint and track data for historical journeys on South Georgia (Carse 1955/6 and Shackleton 1916).

Layer.ows:Title: CCAMLR subareas and South Georgia ISR
Layer.ows:Abstract:
SUBAREA 48.2 : The waters bounded by a line starting at 57°S, 50°W; thence due east to 30°W longitude; thence due south to 64°S latitude; thence due west to 50°W longitude; thence due north to the starting point.
SUBAREA 48.3 : The waters bounded by a line starting at 50°S, 50°W; thence due east to 30°W longitude; thence due south to 57°S latitude; thence due west to 50°W longitude; thence due north to the starting point.
SUBAREA 48.4 : The waters bounded by a line starting at 50°S, 30°W; thence due east to 20°W longitude; thence due south to 64°S latitude; thence due west to 30°W longitude; thence due north to the starting point.
South Georgia ISR : The area bounded by a line starting at 53°S, 40°W, thence due east to 35°W longitude, thence due south to 56°S latitude, thence due west to 40°W longitude, thence due north to the starting point.
Source : http://www.ccamlr.org/pu/E/conv/defn-bnd091202.pdf

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Rothera point hazards
Layer.ows:Abstract: Point locations of 'potentially hazardous features' and 'non-hazardous features' on Rothera Point.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic IBRU boundary claims
Layer.ows:Abstract: Source: 'International Boundaries Research Unit, Durham University' (http://www.dur.ac.uk/ibru/resources/arctic/). PDF version of the map available at : http://www.dur.ac.uk/resources/ibru/arctic.pdf.

Layer.ows:Title: SG current occupation detail
Layer.ows:Abstract: Polygon digitisation of buildings/areas occupied 2012.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic coastal change
Layer.ows:Abstract: Coastal change, including ice shelves, measured from maps, aerial photographs and remote sensing imagery. Includes data up to 2008. Metadata for individual line segments is contained in the attribute table. USGS Coastal-Change and Glaciological Maps of Antarctica project eg. Williams, R. S., Ferrigno, J. G., Swithinbank, C., Lucchitta, B. K., and Seekins, B. A.: Coastal-change and glaciological maps of Antarctica, Annals of Glaciology, Vol 21, 1995: Proceedings of the International Symposium on the Role of the Cryosphere in Global Change, edited by: Rothrock, D. A., 284-290 pp., 1995

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Ryder Bay CTD dive points
Layer.ows:Abstract: CTD and dive waypoints in the Ryder bay area for season 2014-2015.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic seamask med res
Layer.ows:Abstract: Seamask created by subtracting medium resolution coastline polygon data (Antarctic and Sub-Antarctic) from a 50S polygon.

Layer.ows:Title: SG 8-bit DEM hillshade
Layer.ows:Abstract: 8-bit hillshade raster (z=5) created in ARCGIS 10.0 from original SG DEM.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic land-based ice
Layer.ows:Abstract: Brown, J., O.J. Ferrians, Jr., J.A. Heginbottom, and E.S. Melnikov. 1998, revised February 2001. Circum-arctic map of permafrost and ground ice conditions. Boulder, CO: National Snow and Ice Data Center/World Data Center for Glaciology. Digital media. National Snow and Ice Data Center (NSIDC) http://nsidc.org/data/docs/fgdc/ggd318_map_circumarctic/index.html

Layer.ows:Title: SG official GSGSSI visitor sites
Layer.ows:Abstract: Data from Pat Lurcock, Government Officer, South Georgia, September 2007, updated for 2010 season. These are all the officially approved public landing sites.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops Twin Otter ranges with extended range fuel tank
Layer.ows:Abstract: Polygons showing extended flight ranges for the BAS Twin Otter Aircraft with extended range fuel tank from suitable runways - bases with associated ice landing strips.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic coastline (all resolutions) transparent fill
Layer.ows:Abstract:
Seamless dataset for Antarctic coastline applicable to all zoom levels. Data is a compendium of three line/polygon datasets which should display well at all zoom levels.
Highest resolution data prepared Cooper A.P.R BAS 2011 from various sources. For the line data, each segment is attributed with metadata concerning its source, updater and update time. Last updated January 2013, Fretwell P, BAS from remote sensing imagery dating from 2011. Main areas of update : Antarctic Peninsula and South Orkney Islands. This is the most accurate vector data for land south of -60.
Medium resolution data has been generalised from the high resolution dataset using ArcGIS generalisation tool with maximum offset of 100m.
Low resolution data has been generalised from the high resolution dataset using ArcGIS generalisation tool with maximum offset of 1km.
This dataset has been styled with the polygon data having transparent fills. This enables the overlaying of the coastline on other data.

Layer.ows:Title: SG Whitechin petrel populations by area
Layer.ows:Abstract: Percentage of island population on a per-zone basis, where South Georgia is divided into 8 zones. Martin A.R, Poncet S, Barbraud C, Foster E, Fretwell P, Rothery P, Polar Biology DOI 10.1007/s00300-008-0570-5.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic coastline (all resolutions)
Layer.ows:Abstract:
Seamless dataset for Antarctic coastline applicable to all zoom levels. Data is a compendium of three line/polygon datasets which should display well at all zoom levels.
Highest resolution data prepared Cooper A.P.R BAS 2011 from various sources. For the line data, each segment is attributed with metadata concerning its source, updater and update time. Last updated January 2013, Fretwell P, BAS from remote sensing imagery dating from 2011. Main areas of update : Antarctic Peninsula and South Orkney Islands. This is the most accurate vector data for land south of -60.
Medium resolution data has been generalised from the high resolution dataset using ArcGIS generalisation tool with maximum offset of 100m.
Low resolution data has been generalised from the high resolution dataset using ArcGIS generalisation tool with maximum offset of 1km.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic Sea Mask (all resolutions)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Seamless access to Antarctic Sea Mask data applicable to all resolutions. A compendium of three polygon datasets which should display well at all resolutions. The masks were created by subtracting the appropriate resolution coastline polygon dataset from a 50 degree roundel centered on the S pole.

Layer.ows:Title: SG whaling station locations
Layer.ows:Abstract: Locations of historic whaling stations.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic coastline med res (line)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Prepared Cooper A.P.R BAS 2011 from various sources. This data has been generalised from the antarctic_coastline_line_high dataset. Used ArcMap generalisation tool with maximum offset of 100m.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic coastline
Layer.ows:Abstract:
Based on National Imagery and Mapping Agency's (NIMA) Vector Map Level 0 (Vmap), Scale 1:1,000,000 http://earth-info.nga.mil/publications/vmap0.html

National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency VMAP0 download page: http://geoengine.nga.mil/muse-cgi-bin/rast_roam.cgi

As an agency of the United States government, NIMA makes no copyright claim under Title 17 of the United States Code with respect to any copyrightable material compiled in these products, nor requires compensation for their use.
a. "this product was developed using materials from the United States National Imagery and Mapping Agency and are reproduced with permission",
b. "this product has neither been endorsed nor authorized by the United States National Imagery and Mapping Agency or the United States Department of Defense".

Edits were made based on NASA Landsat ETM+ images.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic contours high res (line)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Prepared Cooper A.P.R, BAS 2011. Updates around Pine Island Glacier/Burke Island by Fretwell P, BAS 04/05/2012. Further updates around the Antarctic Peninsula and South Orkney Islands January 2013, Fretwell P, BAS. Sources of individual line segments are contained in the data attributes. Last update 14/01/2015.

Layer.ows:Title: LIMA tile mosaic
Layer.ows:Abstract: The LIMA tile index grid (BAS 2007). See http://lima.usgs.gov/.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic contours over ice
Layer.ows:Abstract: Extracted from the Digital Elevation Model backdrop.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic surface DEM
Layer.ows:Abstract: Composite DEM derived from the following datasets: GEBCO 2014 (50-60S), BEDMAP2 bed data (60S-Antarctic coastline), BEDMAP2 surface dataset (Antarctic land mass).

Layer.ows:Title: SG 750m resolution bathymetry from GEBCO
Layer.ows:Abstract: The GEBCO_08 Grid — a global 30 arc-second grid. Released: November 2009 - generated by combining quality-controlled ship depth soundings with interpolation between sounding points guided by satellite derived gravity data. http://www.gebco.net, downloaded from BODC at https://www.bodc.ac.uk/data/online_delivery/gebco/gebco_08_grid/ (registration required).

Layer.ows:Title: SG current routes
Layer.ows:Abstract: Whittamore L, BAS 2007 GPS data St Andrew's Bay->Sorling, Maiviken Hike, Grytviken->Mt Hodges), GSGSSI data 2009 (KEP->cemetery, KEP->Hope Point, Grytviken station->church, Grytviken station routes), Poncet S, South Georgia Environmental Baseline Survey 1999-2002, map 14 (Fortuna Bay Shackleton hike).

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic principal river labels
Layer.ows:Abstract: Line dataset indicating where principal river names are to be plotted. Very basic set, could be significantly added to.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops BIGMAP 2014-15
Layer.ows:Abstract: Digital version of BIGMAP 2014-15 .Information on the sources of data can be found in the original data files for BAS operations BIGMAP 2014.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic bed DEM
Layer.ows:Abstract: Composite DEM comprising the following datasets: GEBCO 2014 (50-60S), BEDMAP2 bed dataset (60-90S). Full details of BEDMAP2 can be found in this paper: http://www.the-cryosphere.net/7/375/2013/tc-7-375-2013.pdf. Please cite this paper when referring to bedmap2.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic Circle
Layer.ows:Abstract: The Antarctic Circle is one of the five major circles (or parallels) of latitude that mark maps of the Earth. For 2012, it is the parallel of latitude that runs 66° 33′ 44″ (or 66.5622°) south of the Equator. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antarctic_Circle

Layer.ows:Title: Ops iStar proposed positions 2014-15
Layer.ows:Abstract: Point locations of proposed istar positions, season 2014-2015.

Layer.ows:Title: SG field huts
Layer.ows:Abstract: Currently used field huts and refuges on SG mainland. Adapted Herbert D, BAS 2009 from original 1996 GIS data and pers comm with GSGSSI.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic facilities from COMNAP
Layer.ows:Abstract: Downloaded 13/02/2015 from COMNAP https://comnap.aq/Information/SiteAssets/SitePages/Home/Antarctic_Facilities_List_13Feb2014.xls.

Layer.ows:Title: SG glacier_change
Layer.ows:Abstract:
Analysis of aerial photography, historical photos and remote sensing imagery to provide positions of key glacier fronts over the past century. Cook A, BAS 2009.

Publication: Cook, Alison; Poncet, Sally; Cooper, A.P.R; Herbert, David; Christie, D.. 2010 Glacier retreat on South Georgia and implications for the spread of rats. Antarctic Science, 22 (3). 255-263.

Layer.ows:Title: Ops BAS DASH-7 Aircraft runways
Layer.ows:Abstract: Point locations of runways suitable for the BAS DASH-7 Aircraft, groomed ice runways.

Layer.ows:Title: Composite hillshade for Antarctica to 50S
Layer.ows:Abstract: Composite hillshade comprising the following datasets: GEBCO 2014 (50S-60S), BEDMAP2 bed dataset (60S-Antarctic continental coast), BEDMAP2 surface dataset (Antarctic land mass). 8 bit raster created by using gdaldem with a z value of 10.

Layer.ows:Title: SG historic artefacts
Layer.ows:Abstract: Poncet S, BAS 2007, unpublished 2006 survey data. Dataset filtered for universal consumption.

Layer.ows:Title: SG seamount locations
Layer.ows:Abstract: A. Kitchingman, and S. Lai. 2004. Inferences on Potential Seamount Locations from Mid-Resolution Bathymetric Data. In T. Morato and D. Pauly, FCRR Seamounts: Biodiversity and Fisheries, Fisheries Centre Research Reports. University of British Columbia. 12:7 - 12. Clipped to Scotia sea area Herbert D, BAS 2010.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic coastline low res (polygon)
Layer.ows:Abstract: Prepared Cooper A.P.R BAS 2011 from various sources. Generalised Fretwell P, BAS 2012 from the antarctic_coastline_polygon_high most detailed dataset for use at 1:10000000 scale. Used ArcMap generalisation tool with a maximum offset of 1km. All features with an area < 1 square km were subsequently removed.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic graticule 50S -> 90S
Layer.ows:Abstract: Antarctic graticule generated 02/03/2012 Herbert D, BAS using PostGIS. Extended as far north as 50S with lines of longitude ending at 89S. The dataset includes lines of longitude at 30' intervals, and lines of latitude at 15' intervals. Zoom-dependent styling can be applied to render a suitably dense graticule for any zoom level. Note that the lines of longitude stop at 89S - inclusion of the South Pole can be problematic for WMS systems.

Layer.ows:Title: Antarctic contours low res (line)
Layer.ows:Abstract: ADD5 version with minor consistency updates done 9/2014.

Layer.ows:Title: Radarsat 2 RAMP 3 mosaic HH
Layer.ows:Abstract: Radarsat 2 RAMP 3 mosaic HH polarization.

Layer.ows:Title: Sub-Antarctic coastline low resolution to 30S
Layer.ows:Abstract: Sub-Antarctic coastline, extended by including data from naturalearthdata.com version 3.0.0 (downloaded 04/03/2016) to 30S.

Layer.ows:Title: SG habitat mapping areas
Layer.ows:Abstract: Source : Poncet S, South Georgia Environmental Baseline Survey 1999-2002, originally prepared in Corel Draw, digitised by Foster, E, Herbert, D BAS 2008.

Layer.ows:Title: SG seamask polygon
Layer.ows:Abstract: Created in ARCMap 10.0 using erase on 1 degree densified polygon (-50 -65, -18, -50) with coastline polygon.

Layer.ows:Title: SG historic routes
Layer.ows:Abstract:
Carse journey 1955, second (southern) journey 1956 - Poncet S, pers comm with Alec Trendall Aug-Oct 2007, interpreted Herbert D, BAS 2007 using Carse The Survey of South Georgia 1951-7, reprinted in The Geographical Journal, Vol CXXV Part 1, March 1959.

Shackleton route 1916 - Poncet S, pers comm with Alec Trendall Aug-Oct 2007, interpreted Herbert D, BAS 2007.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic permafrost and ground-ice conditions
Layer.ows:Abstract: Brown, J., O.J. Ferrians, Jr., J.A. Heginbottom, and E.S. Melnikov.. 2002. Circum-Arctic Map of Permafrost and Ground-Ice Conditions. Version 2. Boulder, Colorado USA: National Snow and Ice Data Center. See http://nsidc.org/data/docs/fgdc/ggd318_map_circumarctic/ for detailed explanation of the map key.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic major roads
Layer.ows:Abstract:
Based on NIMA Vmap0 data (see under Coastlines, above).

Railways and roads have been generalized with reference to:
- The Times Comprehensive Atlas of the World, 10th Edition 911, Times Books Group Ltd 1999
- The Atlas of Canada North Circumpolar Region
http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/maps/reference/international/north_circumpolar

Layer.ows:Title: Currently occupied sites
Layer.ows:Abstract: Seamless dataset displaying point locations for zoomed-out (denominator > 100000) and polygon inventory for zoomed in.

Layer.ows:Title: Rothera runway and apron 2016
Layer.ows:Abstract: Redigitised as part of the Rothera 2016 area map, Gerrish L, BAS Feb 2016. Removed from the buildings layer where it was originally.

Layer.ows:Title: Arctic hillshade and bathymetry
Layer.ows:Abstract: Compendium of hillshade/elevation and bathymetric datasets.
